demo.main

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.boot.context.web.SpringBootServletInitializer
      • demo.main.Main
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.web.WebApplicationInitializer

    @EnableAutoConfiguration
 @ComponentScan(value={"demo","demo1","demo2","demo3","demo5"})
 @ImportResource(value="classpath:mvc-configuration.xml")
public class Main
extends org.springframework.boot.context.web.SpringBootServletInitializer
    Main entry point for our application using Spring Boot. It can be run as an executable or as a standard war file.

    Details of annotations used:

    • @EnableAutoConfiguration: makes Spring Boot setup its defaults.
    • @ComponentScan: Scan for @Component classes, including @Configuration classes.
    • @ImportResource: Import Spring XML configuration file(s).
    Author:
    Paul Chapman

    • Field Detail

      • activeProfile

        public static final java.lang.String activeProfile
        How should a SimpleMappingExceptionResolver be created?
        • DEMO (default) - Java Config is used and a custom SimpleMappingExceptionResolver is setup that can be enabled or disabled programmatically (just for the purpose of this demo).
        • XML - Traditional XML bean configuration is used - see mvc-configuration.xml.
        • JAVA - Java Configuration is used - see ExceptionConfiguration.
        • NONE - No SimpleMappingExceptionResolver is created.

        Demo mode is the default - set to "java-config" or "xml-config" to match however you intend to use Spring for a mor realistic setup.

        See Also:
        Profiles, Constant Field Values

      • logger

        protected org.slf4j.Logger logger

      • props

        protected java.util.Properties props

    • Constructor Detail

      • Main

        public Main()
        We are using the constructor to perform some useful initializations:
        1. Set the Spring Profile to use 'controller' or 'global' which in turn selects how exceptions will be handled. Profiles are a Spring feature from V3.1 onwards.
        2. Disable Thymeleaf caching so templates (HTML files with Thymeleaf namespace attributes) can be modified whilst the application is running.
        3. Enable DEBUG level logging so you can see Spring MVC as its working.

    • Method Detail

      • getProfiles

        public static java.lang.String getProfiles()
        Retrieve requested Profiles. Depends on the value of activeProfile.
        Returns:
        Comma-separated list of profiles.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Back to the future: run the application as a Java application and it will pick up a container (Tomcat, Jetty) automatically if present. Pulls in Tomcat by default, running in embedded mode.

        This application can also run as a traditional war file because it extends SpringBootServletInitializer as well.

        Parameters:
        args -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • runAsJavaApplication

        protected void runAsJavaApplication(java.lang.String[] args)
        Run the application using Spring Boot. SpringApplication.run tells Spring Boot to use this class as the initialiser for the whole application (via the class annotations above). This method is only used when running as a Java application.
        Parameters:
        args - Any command line arguments.

      • configure

        protected org.springframework.boot.builder.SpringApplicationBuilder configure(org.springframework.boot.builder.SpringApplicationBuilder application)
        Configure the application using the supplied builder when running as a WAR. This method is invoked automatically when running in a container and explicitly by runAsJavaApplication(String[]).
        Overrides:
        configure in class org.springframework.boot.context.web.SpringBootServletInitializer
        Parameters:
        application - Spring Boot application builder.
